repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters of O. Victor Hancock to his father concerning his job and tobacco prices in Richmond and, later, his experiences in the Civil War, including letters from Manassas, Camp Ewell, and Leesburg describing trench graves, camp life, and sickness among the soldiers.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Letters, 1861-1863, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters of O. Victor Hancock to his father concerning his job and tobacco prices in Richmond and, later, his experiences in the Civil War, including letters from Manassas, Camp Ewell, and Leesburg describing trench graves, camp life, and sickness among the soldiers.
